About Me

I am a 35 year-old single dad. Having grown up in Las Vegas, NV, I attended Advanced Technologies Academy, with a joint major of Computer Graphics and CADD. I moved fully into CADD in sophomore year, and continued with that until graduation. Shortly after graduation, I moved up to St. George, UT, and worked in retail and manufacturing for several years, during which time, I got married and had a child, and then soon divorced. After I was downsized from the manufacturing job, I entered the field of supported living for people with disabilities. I enjoyed working in that field for several years, attaining management levels before deciding to take a different path. I loved helping others, but ultimately, I knew it wasnâ€™t something I could do forever, so I left in search of something new and more fulfilling. I thought back to my high school days of writing joke websites just for entertainment, and my hobby of reverse-engineering video game cheat codes in order to write my own. It was around that time my girlfriend gave me the idea of going back to school to turn an old hobby into a new career, and the rest, as they say, is history.
